events.description: Australia's goods surplus widened to AUD 3.37 billion, exceeding expectations.
The Australian stock index fell 0.2% as mining stocks declined.
Potential merger discussions where sides are divided on valuation and governance.

facts.fact_text: The S&P/ASX 200 fell 0.2% to around 8,900 in early Thursday trade.

evidences.evidence_text: The S&P/ASX 200 fell 0.2% to around 8,900 in early Thursday trade

facts.fact_text: The mining sector slid 1.6% following a retreat in copper and iron ore prices.

evidences.evidence_text: The mining sector slid 1.6% after copper and iron ore prices retreated.

facts.fact_text: Australia’s goods surplus widened to AUD 3.37 billion in December.

evidences.evidence_text: December trade data showed Australia’s goods surplus widened to AUD 3.37 billion

facts.fact_text: BHP shares fell 2.1% while Rio Tinto shares rose 0.1%.

evidences.evidence_text: Global mining giant BHP sank 2.1%, easing from a record high, while its peer Rio Tinto edged up 0.1%.

claims.claim_text: Heavyweight mining stocks were responsible for dragging down the S&P/ASX 200.

evidences.evidence_text: reversing gains from the previous session as heavyweight mining stocks dragged

claims.claim_text: Wisetech Global and Life360 losses were driven by the performance of their Wall Street peers.

evidences.evidence_text: Wisetech Global and Life360 extended losses, down 4% and 2%, respectively, tracking their Wall Street peers lower.

claims.claim_text: Market sentiment was bolstered by the positive trade surplus data.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, market sentiment found support after December trade data showed Australia’s goods surplus widened

evidence.evidence_text: The mining sector slid 1.6% after copper and iron ore prices retreated.
Wisetech Global and Life360 extended losses... tracking their Wall Street peers lower.
market sentiment found support after December trade data showed Australia’s goods surplus widened... as exports rebounded
The S&P/ASX 200 fell 0.2%... as heavyweight mining stocks dragged.
